oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-10-11 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 11, 1941. Featuring Jud Collins (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist San Antonio Rose, Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters, Jack Shook, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, Dee Simmons), and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Roy Acuff; Jack Shook; Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien; Dee Simmons
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: You Are My Sunshine (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay talks -- You Are My Sunshine (reprise) (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- Cool Water (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Jud Collins, George D. Hay, Jack Shook) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Heart That Was Broken For Me (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack, Nap, and Dee -- My Country, 'Tis Of Thee (Jack Shook, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, Dee Simmons, audience) -- Prince Albert commercial (Jud Collins) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Jud Collins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Collins, Jud; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Stone, Oscar, 1881-; Possum Hunters (Musical group); King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Shook, Jack; Bastien, Napoleon; Simmons, Dee (Musician)
